reviews.review_msg: I understood the super high level concepts but once he started explaining the details in class, I didnt understand what he was saying at all. Class was weird because I felt like I was going fail , but yet I got an A. I did however complete the project, even though my partner contributed 0% to it and also got that person an A.

Does not put any work into preparing for classes. Every lecture felt like he was working with a vague idea of what he wanted to teach and was frequently surprised by his own slides. Certainly knows his stuff but not a great teacher.

His class is very interesting. I really enjoyed the content. If you want to get a good grade just go to every class and actually listen to him. There is no chance you will get a bad grade if you do that.

I've got a 3.8 GPA and this guy made me just not even show up to class. Worst professor I've ever had. I aspire to be a teacher one day and from this man, I've learned one thing: how to be a terrible teacher.

The course overall had interesting material but the lectures were often hard to follow, enough that attending lectures become more or less optional. Tests are tough with some questions never fully covered in the course but the bulk of the mark is in the projects, which you are almost guaranteed an A if you put any work in it.

Nice enough guy but terrible teacher. Jumps all over the place with material and uploads terrible quality scanned notes that he has been using since the early 2000's. Class content is interesting but with Mark the focus is always on heavily outdated technology that is tough to relate to. Says tests will be "easy" but includes concepts never covered

Went to his office hr and no one was in line. First thing he said was he's busy so make it quick. I asked him my questions which he made everything more confusing, then told me to come back later. There was 15 min of office hr left with no one behind me. I dont think he gets what office hrs are for. He clearly doesn't care if you learn or not.

Hi is very nice and his course is easy. For the project, he basically gives all the pieces of the code; if you attend the lecture you will be able to put them together. Then, it is just to write the report.
Nothing matters, just attend class and say everything that comes to your mind instantly. you project and your presentation, whatever it is, will get A+.  JUST TALK NONSENSE and you'll be fine!
Mark is a really nice professor; hilarious in the class. I found the class very helpful. You have to study the material beforehand and it would be really easy to catch up.
Very nice professor. I really LOVED him. So funny and enjoyable class. It was the best grad course I've ever had. Very nice personality.

Most confusing and scattered lectures ever.  Every example "looks like a good midtermfinal question". By the 4th week only 15 people are still attending lecture because it's so USELESS. The assignments are random and pointless. You will NOT learn anything, but only rip your hair out worrying about failing. Do yourself a favor - AVOID AVOID AVOID.

Easy grader, I barely learned anything in this course, teaches fast. Almost failed both exams but final grade was around an A. The 2nd assignment and project was extremely difficult. However, he gives everyone extremely good marks for the effort. My programs basically did not do what he asked and I still managed to get a good grade.
Not a hard course to ace, but don't expect to learn a lot
It's not hard to get a pass, but it's really hard to understand the content. Not recommend to take it with this prof.
He's a good prof, teaches well.

He wrote the textbook, but it is outdated (ten years). His main problem is that he does not understand how much time is needed to answer his exam questions. Even if you know all the answers, there is no time to write them down. So everybody gets the same mark, whether or not you knew the answers! No time for writing the answers anyway.

He wrote the textbook and is a treasure trove of knowledge. The assignments can be difficult as lot of students seem to cheat on the project which translates to a lot of work you have to do for equal quality.
Fantastically knowledgeable. Nice attitude toward the students and class. Really energetic. Gorgeous personality.
nice prof. He knows his stuff very well. Hard exams though.
WOW! The Best Professor in Graduate Level. I hope there were more professors like him.
He is very affectionate, smart and considerate. In his course you don't get credit because of your background knowledge , but because of your attempt you invest. Loved his attitude and his class.

He is a dedicated professor and scientist. He knows a lot and is definitely genius in communication. He's really kind and cares about each of the students, not only for the course's sake but for their own future as well.
His knowledge is indeed very extensive. He cared a lot about his class and each student individually.

He is one the most knowledgeable professors I have ever seen. He explains very clean with lots of enthusiasm. Very patiently  explains the stuff over and over if necessary. Very funny and energetic. TOTALLY INSPIRING.

You've got to give this prof a chance.  He does come off as goofy and uncaring at times but he really knows his stuff and you will learn it if you apply yourself.  His lectures  are entertaining and his assignments are fair. He puts a large emphasis on effort, so if he sees you tried you will do well.  A good professor, try his course!
confusing and confused. in one hour of class he taught for less than half.
He is the worst professor I have ever had. I would never take another class with him ever again.
great prof.

It is obvious from his lectures that he has no interest in the course. He wasted many lectures showing past student projects and rushed through harder part of the course. His exams test your application of the course materials, which was never covered in lectures and assignments, thus giving you no practice beforehand and no chance to prepare.
very funny professor. makes lots of jokes and eases students into the course. knows the stuff to absolute precision. great guy.
WOW!

Just a super amazing Prof. So helpful and kind. If anyone out there likes to work with color images with a World re-known Prof, Dr. Drew is the guy. Not only will he guide you to do great, state of the art research, but also he will hook you up with endless top industry professionals (if this is your thing). SUPERB!
goofy, but good prof, pretty easy the only hard part of this course was the 2nd assignment. laugh at his jokes maybe you'll get a good mark.

Knows his material very well, maybe a little too well, as he assumes we should easily be able to follow his chicken scratch notes. Doesn't know how to TEACH, and midterm/final was misleading. VERY disorganized prof. Good sense of humor but that's the only good thing about him.

Was a reasonably hard course, but not unexpected for an upper division cmpt sci course.  GOOD communication skills, is a native english speaker unlike some other profs in this faculty.  Excellent course material if you're willing to work at understanding it.
loved the multimedia projects, but lectures were very difficult to follow for non-native-english speakers. no textbook used.

He is knowledgeable in multimedia, but when it comes to teaching, he doesn't know jack. His midterm and final are way out of whack. Advice: don't even bother study for the final, he is going to make u cry anyways.
Lacks communication skills. Not a good skill to be missing when TEACHING! After my first class with him I tried to avoid him for 2 years but had to take a multimedia course with him...regret it.
Disorganised prof and unclear on what we actually need to know...
Unpredictable on tests...
Part marks for everything..quote:  My second cousin once removed.. ..corny jokes
No Comments
Funny and exotic teaching style.  The harder you work, the better mark you get.
The worst prof I've ever had.
The most boring CMPT course I have taken. Not to mention bad lecturer.
Very disorganised notes and lectures.  Very bad teaching skills - unclear.
He is nice prof but exam..................
A multimedia professor whose notes are a multimedia mess.  Very confusing style.
